metadata.description: College KPI extraction schema with keywords for accurate data retrieval

kpis.extraction_instruction: Set TRUE if any of these are mentioned: smart classrooms, LMS platforms (Moodle, Canvas, Blackboard), virtual labs, e-learning infrastructure. Set FALSE only if explicitly stated as unavailable. Set NULL if no mention found. Do NOT confuse with general computer labs.
kpis.notes: Look for specific technology mentions like 'smart classrooms', 'LMS', platform names. General 'computer lab' alone is NOT sufficient.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Set TRUE if digital library services or subscriptions to e-resources (DELNET, NDL, IEEE, Springer, etc.) are mentioned. Set FALSE only if explicitly stated as unavailable. Set NULL if unclear.
kpis.notes: Look for specific platform names: DELNET, NDL, IEEE Xplore, Springer, N-LIST, Shodhganga

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the NUMBER of separate hostel buildings/blocks for male students managed by the college. Look for phrases like '3 boys hostels' or 'three hostels for male students'. If only capacity (beds/seats) is mentioned without building count, set NULL. Do NOT count private hostels.
kpis.notes: Count buildings/blocks, not beds or capacity. Only college-managed hostels count.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the NUMBER of separate hostel buildings/blocks for female students managed by the college. Look for phrases like '2 girls hostels' or 'two hostels for female students'. If only capacity (beds/seats) is mentioned without building count, set NULL. Do NOT count private hostels.
kpis.notes: Count buildings/blocks, not beds or capacity. Only college-managed hostels count.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Set TRUE if any ERP system, campus management software, student portal, or smart campus initiative is mentioned. Look for system names (SAP, Oracle) or features like 'online fee payment', 'biometric attendance', 'student portal'. Set FALSE only if explicitly unavailable. Set NULL if unclear.
kpis.notes: Look for specific system names or digital automation features

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract ALL program/course names as an array of strings. Include full names with specializations (e.g., 'B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering'). Format: ['B.Tech CSE', 'B.Tech ECE', 'MBA', ...]. Include UG, PG, and PhD programs.
kpis.notes: Use standard abbreviations. Include specializations/branches if mentioned.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Create an object mapping course names to ANNUAL tuition fees in INR. Format: {'B.Tech CSE': 150000, 'MBA': 200000}. If semester fees are given, multiply by 2 for annual. EXCLUDE hostel, mess, transport, exam fees. If total fee is given for full program, divide by duration years.
kpis.notes: Convert to annual fees. Exclude non-tuition charges. Use null for courses with unknown fees.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the total number of students graduating in academic year 2024-25 (batch of 2025). Look for 'Class of 2025', 'graduating batch 2025', or placement reports for 2024-25. If exact 2025 data unavailable, use most recent graduation data and note the year in remarks.
kpis.notes: Includes all UG and PG graduating students. May be found in placement reports or convocation data.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the NUMBER of students who received job offers through campus placements. Use latest available placement season data. If only percentage is given, calculate: (percentage × total_graduate_students) / 100. Do NOT include internship offers unless specified as PPOs (Pre-Placement Offers).
kpis.notes: Use latest placement season. Include PPOs. Exclude off-campus placements unless included in official data.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the HIGHEST annual CTC (Cost to Company) offered in the latest placement season. Convert LPA to full amount (e.g., 45 LPA = 4500000). If monthly salary is mentioned, multiply by 12. Include international offers converted to INR if mentioned.
kpis.notes: Always use CTC (Cost to Company), not in-hand salary. Convert LPA format to full rupees.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the MEDIAN (50th percentile) annual CTC of placed students. IMPORTANT: Median is NOT the same as average/mean. If only average is available and median is not mentioned, set NULL. Convert LPA to full amount.
kpis.notes: STRICTLY median only, NOT average. If only average is available, do not use it here. Many colleges report average, which is different from median.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the AVERAGE (mean) annual CTC of placed students. This is different from median. Convert LPA to full amount. If only median is available and average is not mentioned, set NULL.
kpis.notes: STRICTLY average/mean only, NOT median.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the number of graduating students who opted for higher education (Masters/PhD) instead of placements. Include both domestic (IITs, IIMs, etc.) and international (MS abroad) admissions. May be found in placement reports under 'higher studies' section.
kpis.notes: Includes MS, MBA, PhD admissions. Often reported alongside placement data.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the number of patents GRANTED (preferred) or FILED in the latest academic year. Prioritize 'granted' over 'filed' if both are available. Specify in notes whether it's granted or filed. Check NIRF data, annual reports.
kpis.notes: Prefer granted patents. Note whether filed or granted. Include both faculty and student patents.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the PRIMARY entrance exam name for undergraduate admissions (e.g., 'JEE Main', 'KCET', 'COMEDK'). If multiple exams are accepted, list the main one first. For PG programs, mention separately if significant (e.g., 'GATE for M.Tech').
kpis.notes: Common exams: JEE Main, JEE Advanced, NEET, COMEDK, KCET, MHT-CET, WBJEE, BITSAT, CAT, GATE

kpis.extraction_instruction: Create an object mapping course names to cutoff values. Format: {'B.Tech CSE': 15000, 'B.Tech ECE': 25000} for ranks OR {'B.Tech CSE': 95.5} for percentiles. Specify in notes whether values are ranks or percentiles. Use latest admission cycle data.
kpis.notes: Specify if values are ranks (lower is better) or percentiles (higher is better). Use latest year's cutoffs.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the TOTAL student enrollment across ALL programs (UG, PG, PhD) and ALL academic years combined. This is the current total headcount, not just new admissions. Check NIRF data or annual reports for accurate figures.
kpis.notes: Include all years and all programs. Different from annual intake which is only new admissions.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the COUNT of female students currently enrolled. If only percentage/ratio is given, calculate: (female_percentage × total_students_enrolled) / 100. Round to nearest integer.
kpis.notes: Extract actual count. If percentage given (e.g., '30% female'), calculate from total enrollment.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the total number of FULL-TIME/REGULAR faculty members. EXCLUDE visiting faculty, adjunct professors, guest lecturers unless they are counted in official strength. Check NIRF data or NAAC reports.
kpis.notes: Only permanent/regular faculty. Exclude visiting/guest faculty unless specified otherwise.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the number of faculty members who have COMPLETED PhD degrees. Do not count those 'pursuing PhD'. If percentage is given, calculate from total_faculty. Check NAAC or NIRF reports.
kpis.notes: Only completed PhDs count. 'Pursuing PhD' should NOT be included.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the AVERAGE years of teaching experience across all faculty. Look for specific numbers like '12.5 years average experience'. If only a range is given (e.g., '10-15 years'), use midpoint. If individual experiences listed, calculate average.
kpis.notes: Teaching experience only, not industry experience unless combined.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract as object with two arrays: 'facilities' (list of sports facilities) and 'achievements' (notable sports achievements/wins). Format: {'facilities': ['Cricket Ground', 'Gymnasium', 'Swimming Pool'], 'achievements': ['Inter-University Champions 2024']}
kpis.notes: Separate facilities from achievements. Include both indoor and outdoor facilities.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract an array of currently active student club/society names. Include technical clubs (Coding Club, Robotics), cultural clubs (Music, Drama), professional chapters (IEEE, ACM), and service clubs (NSS, NCC, Rotaract).
kpis.notes: Include all types: technical, cultural, professional chapters, service organizations.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the latest NIRF ranking. If specific rank available, use format 'Rank 45' or just '45'. If only band available, use format '51-100' or '101-150'. If not ranked, use 'Not Ranked'. Specify category (Engineering/Overall/University) if mentioned.
kpis.notes: Use most recent NIRF data. Note the category (Engineering, Overall, University, Management).

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the institutional status. Common values: 'Autonomous College', 'Deemed to be University', 'Private University', 'State University', 'Central University', 'Affiliated College (to XYZ University)'. Include affiliating university name if applicable.
kpis.notes: Include affiliating university name for affiliated colleges.

kpis.extraction_instruction: Extract the total number of students currently enrolled in PhD/doctoral programs across all departments. Look in NIRF data, research section, or academic reports. Different from 'PhD faculty' which refers to faculty with PhD degrees.
kpis.notes: Current PhD students, not PhD completions or PhD faculty. Check NIRF for accurate data.

extraction_rules.currency_conversion: Convert all monetary values to annual INR. 1 LPA = 100000 INR. Monthly × 12 = Annual.
extraction_rules.null_handling: Use null for missing/unknown information. NEVER use 0 or false for unknown values.
extraction_rules.year_preference: Use latest available data (2024-25 or 2025-26 preferred). Note the actual year in remarks if different.
extraction_rules.multiple_sources: Priority order: 1) Official college website, 2) NIRF data, 3) NAAC reports, 4) Verified third-party sources
extraction_rules.data_recency: Prefer current academic year data. If using older data, note the year.
extraction_rules.percentage_to_count: When percentage given, calculate count using: (percentage × total) / 100, round to nearest integer
extraction_rules.lpa_conversion: LPA (Lakhs Per Annum): 1 LPA = 100,000 INR. Example: 45 LPA = 4,500,000 INR
